meanings.definition: The quality or state of being able to be stained.
meanings.sent1: The stainabilities of the fabric made it difficult to keep clean.
meanings.sent2: I was surprised by the stainabilities of the white shirt.
meanings.sent3: The stainabilities of the carpet turned cleaning into a never-ending task.
meanings.sent4: Her reputation had the stainabilities of a white cloth, easily tarnished.
meanings.sent5: The stainabilities of the wood were evident after the spill.

meanings.definition: The ability to be marked or discolored by a substance.
meanings.sent1: The stainabilities of the paper made it unsuitable for watercolor painting.
meanings.sent2: His shoes had high stainabilities, showing every mark.
meanings.sent3: The stainabilities of the wall were tested by the mischievous toddler.
meanings.sent4: The stainabilities of the stone resembled a canvas for nature's art.
meanings.sent5: The stainabilities of the carpet were evident after the party.
